jeroen commented on issue #3470: ARROW-4351: [C++] Fix CMake errors when neither building shared libraries nor tests
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3470#issuecomment-457062315
 
 
   After this patch cmake succeeds, but my build fails with:
   
   ```
   /tmp/apache-arrow-20190123-61204-fcsbmp/apache-arrow-0.12.0/cpp/thrift_ep-prefix/src/thrift_ep/compiler/cpp/src/thrift/thrifty.yy:1.1-5: invalid directive: `%code'
   /tmp/apache-arrow-20190123-61204-fcsbmp/apache-arrow-0.12.0/cpp/thrift_ep-prefix/src/thrift_ep/compiler/cpp/src/thrift/thrifty.yy:1.7-14: syntax error, unexpected identifier
   make[5]: *** [compiler/cpp/thrift/thrifty.cc] Error 1
   make[4]: *** [compiler/cpp/CMakeFiles/parse.dir/all] Error 2
   make[4]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
   ```

fields.summary: [C++] Fail to build with static parquet

comments.body: Yes, this should work. There seem to be multiple (easy to fix) problems when disabling shared libraries. I'm taking a look
